title: Mercedes A250e PHEV review: a cultured plug-in hybrid spoiled by a few bad manners
text:
Last year’s plug-in hybrid vehicle (PHEV) sales were riding high, spurred by generous Government grants, benefit-in-kind tax sweeteners and write-down allowances. Then last November the Government slashed PHEV grants and allowances, claiming the changes proved the success of the scheme - although many insiders felt they had misjudged the scheme and run through the grant pot too quickly, just as they’d done with LPG fuels in the past.

The effect of those cuts has been devastating. This August, UK PHEV sales had fallen by 71.8 per cent to only 907 vehicles and year-on-year PHEV sales are down from 27,918 to 17,594 (or 37%).
